intro: Saracha geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Saracha geniculata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique growth pattern and delicate foliage.
